meanings.definition: Resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering.
meanings.sent1: She remained steadfast in her decision to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: He is known for his steadfast loyalty to his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat was surprisingly steadfast in its determination to catch the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: Her steadfast belief in herself was like a beacon guiding her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood steadfast against the strong winds, unmoving and strong.

meanings.sent1: The steadfast gaze of the lighthouse beacon guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle remained steadfast, pointing north without wavering.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner moved with a steadfast determination to clean every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed steadfastly towards the sea, never deviating from its course.
meanings.sent5: The soldier marched steadfastly towards the enemy lines, unwavering in his resolve.
